result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Rivero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**2 days credit if probation revoked.**  *Case 21CT377 dismissed and read in.*

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with N.G. or N.G.'s residence without prior written permission from the Probation Agent and N.G. 
Not to drive without a valid driver's license.

Complete an Anger Management and Domestic Violence assessment and follow through with recommendations within the first 18 months of probation. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L. Rivero

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
Dated 10/06/2022, Letter from Court to ADA Fallon regarding request for review of Judgment of Conviction.
Dated 10/04/2022, Letter from Corrections Sentencing Associate Advanced Maggie Hutchens to Court requesting a review of the Judgment of Conviction.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.

(4:25 PM cases 21CT377, 22CF521 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher L. Rivero in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Christopher L. Rivero.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Prior offense acknowledged for Repeater enhancers.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF521 Count 1: Domestic Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic Abuse Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CF521 Count 1.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:
No contact with N.G. or N.G.'s residence without prior written permission from the Probation Agent and N.G. Complete an Anger Management and Domestic Violence assessment and follow through with recommendations within the first 18 months of probation. Not to drive without a valid driver's license. 120 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs to include domestic abuse assessment. 2 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 21CT377, 21TR8534 are dismissed and read in.
Status conference on July 27, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

(Cases called at 9:55 AM - 21CT377 and 22CF521)
Defendant Christopher Rivero appears with Attorney Francis Rivard.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Information received in 22CF521. 
Status Conference: July 27, 2022 at 4:15 PM
Same as Complaint
Arraignment on July 20, 2022 at 09:55 am.

(2:29 PM cases 21CT377, 22CF521 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  
Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher L. Rivero in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Christopher L. Rivero.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Arraignment in 22CF521 and Hearing in 21CT377 scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 9:55 am in person.

Attorney Francis Rivard at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $35 beginning 06/24/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Cases 22CF521, 21CT377 are called at 1:53 PM- by Zoom)  Defendant Christopher L. Rivero in court without counsel.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. Officer Abby Lokkesome appears by video. 
Defendant indicates he is seeking counsel. Court discusses time limits for preliminary with the Defendant. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing in order to get counsel. 
Preliminary Hearing: 06/21/2022 at 2:00 PM. (21CT377 to ride along) Officer is available 06/21/2022 at 2:00 PM.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Officer Abbigail Lokkesmoe may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 05/24/2022.
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely
Request to Appear Remotely

Conditions:
No contact with N.G. or N.G.'s residence.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through 3rd party.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 21CT377, 22CF521 are called at 11:15 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Christopher Rivero appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant executed in 21CT377. Defense waives reading of complaint in 22CF521. State requests $500 cash bond- recites failures to appear. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $300 cash bond with various conditions. Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. Court orders bond continues in 21CT377. 
Preliminary Hearing: 05/24/2022 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with N.G. or N.G.'s residence.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through 3rd party.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
